citeinfo.title: Total Payroll by Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) Code, United States Counties, 1995, MaconUSA

descript.abstract: This dataset is a polygon layer providing county-level boundary and total payroll (in dollars) by Standard Industrial Classification (SIC) code data for the United States, 1995. The Payroll layer is part of a subset of business datasets derived from MaconUSA's 'Maps and Data for Microsoft Office 95', published in 1996. Business datasets include US County Business Data with detailed counts of Total Establishments, Total Payroll, and Total Employees for 200 Categories of businesses organized by Standard Industrial Code (SIC).In addition to the Business datasets, individual demographic and marketing datasets for all 50 states plus the District of Columbia at both the Census tract and ZIP code level were derived from the "Maps and data" data set. State and county-level demographic and marketing layers were also derived from the "Maps and data" dataset. Original dataset sources include: the Claritas Update, Claritas Financial CLOUT database, Claritas Consumer CLOUT database, the U.S. Bureau of Labor Statistics, the U.S. Census Bureau, various other federal, state, and local governmental agencies, and businesses.
descript.purpose: This layer is intended for researchers, students, and policy makers for reference and mapping purposes, and may be used for basic applications such as viewing, querying, and map output production, or to provide a basemap to support graphical overlays and analysis with other spatial data.

idinfo.accconst: Access is granted to Harvard University Affiliates only. Affiliates are limited to current faculty, staff and students.
idinfo.native: Originally produced for Microsoft Office 95 (Windows 95) as MapInfo TAB files; converted to ArcSDE 9.1 layers using ArcGIS 9.3

citeinfo.title: Maps and data : for Microsoft Office 95

procstep.procdesc: This layer was created from fifty-one individual state county files (**COUNTY.tab) that were downloaded from the "MaconUSA Maps and Data for Microsoft Office 95" compact disc. Each file was translated from MapInfo TAB file format to ESRI shapefile format using Safe Software's 2009 FME Universal Translator. Using ESRI ArcMap 9.3 software each shapefile was then joined to the corresponding state's Excel spreadsheet (**BUS1CT.xls/TTL Payroll tab) located on the MaconUSA CD. The joined data was exported in ArcMap and saved as a new shapefile called "**BUSCNTY_pay". For each of the fifty-one shapefiles, the unique attribute named 'GEOCNTY**' was renamed to 'GEOCNTYUS', and then all fifty-one shapefiles were merged into one shapefile using the 'merge' tool in ArcToolbox. ArcCatalog 9.3 was utilized to import the shapefile into an ArcSDE 9.3.1 database using the "Feature Class to Feature Class" import tool.
